title: Air Surveillance Planning Approach for Large Areas
abstract: We consider an area we would like to scan using drones that can perform air surveillance, the area is too large for one drone in a mission can reach and scan. In our approach, the environment is modulated in a grid view, and each node (so called point) has a given priority, this priority define the importance of that point (the need to reach that point). The problem is processed as two sub-problems, the first part focuses on dividing the area to smaller zones which the drone can perform in a mission while meeting the required constraints. The drone has a limit energy, so a limit trajectory to perform. In the second part of the problem, we should find the best (optimal) trajectory for each zone, starting from a specific point and returning to it. The approach we present aim to maximize the gain (priorities sum) of the trajectory in each group of points that belongs to a part of the surveillance area, with the limit budget we have. Up next we detail the problem and discuss the performance of the approach.
